news.title: Zillow shares are getting crushed. Here's why
news.description: Zillow shares fell more than 11% on Monday as investors grew concerned that Google could be testing real estate listings on its search page.

news.title: Trump admin to hire 1,000 specialists for 'Tech Force' to build AI, finance projects
news.description: A slew of tech giants, including Amazon Web Services, Apple, Google Public Sector, Dell Technologies, Microsoft, Nvidia and OpenAI, are listed as partners.

news.title: Hassett's Fed chair candidacy received pushback from high-level people close to Trump, sources say
news.description: There's concern that the National Economic Council director is too close to the president.

news.title: OpenAI poaches Google executive to lead corporate development
news.description: Albert Lee previously led corporate development for Google Cloud and Google DeepMind.

news.title: NYSE insider Jay Woods on stocks, data to watch this week, including a major transport player
news.description: Jay Woods is watching stocks like FedEx in the final full week of trading this year.

news.title: Ukraine peace talks progressing, Russia open to EU membership, U.S. officials say
news.description: The war in Ukraine began nearly four years ago, when Russia invaded at the direction of its leader, Vladimir Putin.

news.title: European defense stocks slide as Zelenskyy ditches Ukraine NATO membership bid
news.description: Defense companies sold off Monday after Kyiv offered to drop its NATO ambitions during negotiations in Berlin.

news.title: Copper could hit 'stratospheric new highs' as hoarding of the metal in U.S. continues
news.description: Spot prices of the red metal hit another high on Friday at $11,816 per ton on the London Metals Exchange, with 3-month futures closing at $11,515.

news.title: SpaceX could be the biggest IPO ever next year. How investors can play it right now
news.description: The SpaceX IPO could reshape valuations across the aerospace industry and deliver a rare blockbuster deal for Wall Street.

news.title: S&P 500 gives up gain as AI-related stocks come under pressure again: Live updates
news.description: Key stocks in the artificial intelligence trade continued to face pressure.

news.title: New York AG sues UPS for allegedly shorting Christmas season workers' wages
news.description: "UPS has played the Grinch," New York Attorney General Letitia James said in a new lawsuit accusing the company of shorting seasonal workers on their pay.

news.title: Trump slams Rob Reiner after killing; director's son Nick in custody
news.description: Rob Reiner was a staunch Trump critic, recently saying, "we have a year before this country becomes a full-on autocracy, and democracy completely leaves us."

news.title: BofA's Savita Subramanian says the S&P 500 will rise to 7,100 in 2026, the most bearish forecast on the Street thus far
news.description: The head of U.S. equity and quantitative strategy's target implies just a 4% rise from current levels.

news.title: ServiceNow in talks to acquire cybersecurity startup Armis in potential $7 billion deal, Bloomberg reports
news.description: Software company ServiceNow is in advanced discussions to acquire Armis, a cybersecurity startup last valued at $6.1 billion.

news.title: 'Appetizer economy': Food inflation is on restaurant table as diners go smaller with menu choices
news.description: Spending on restaurant appetizers is booming during this period of food inflation as consumers find creative ways to cut back even as they continue to dine out.

news.title: The case for more Fed rate cuts could rest on a 'systematic overcount' of jobs numbers
news.description: There are indications that policymakers will be more inclined to cut further if the labor market stays weak.

news.title: Trump administration's new quarters feature pilgrims, ditching civil rights theme
news.description: Special quarter-dollar coin designs for the U.S.' 250th birthday feature pilgrims and former presidents rather than previously floated civil rights themes.

news.title: U.S. has to stop taking in 'below-average' immigrants who won't help economy, says Lutnick
news.description: The White House is rolling out its gold card visa.

news.title: Bessent to propose major overhaul of regulatory body created from financial crisis
news.description: In a letter set to be released Thursday, Bessent will recommend changing the approach of the Financial Stability Oversight Council.

news.title: Bessent says U.S. will finish the year with 3% GDP growth, sees 'very strong' holiday season
news.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the economy will end the year on strong footing and said the president was disappointed in economic coverage in the media.

news.title: Jim Cramer says he's not willing to bet against ServiceNow after an analyst sell call
news.description: KeyBanc established a $775 price target, which was right around where ServiceNow was trading Monday after dropping more than 11%.

news.title: From puppies to superheroes, Chinese AI toys are bringing hugs — and hesitation
news.description: China's AI toy industry is growing as Beijing pushes companies and consumers to integrate the technology.

news.title: Palantir CIO Jim Siders leaves to become head of Thrive's new IT services business
news.description: Siders spent more than 12 years at Palantir, recently overseeing its global IT operations, business applications and infrastructure.

news.title: To justify martial law, former South Korean President Yoon tried to provoke North Korea, prosecutors say
news.description: Yoon and his military commanders tried to lure North Korea into mounting an armed aggression against the South, thereby creating grounds for martial law imposition.

news.title: Hong Kong court finds pro-democracy activist Jimmy Lai guilty of sedition and collusion with foreign forces
news.description: The 78-year-old was charged under Hong Kong's controversial national security law, enacted by Beijing in 2020.
